title: Now, those are REAL JHIN BUFFS
body:
Passive AD mult:: 2-40% >>> **4-44%**

Q AD ratio:: 40/45/50/55/60% >>> 40/47.5/55/62.5/70%

W now roots off of ALL damage Jhin deals, not just basic attacks.

ADCs, or maybe the hypercarries IN that class specifically, have been rito's favourite for a while now. And that's dumb.

Good, Jhin is (in my opinion) the most fair adc to play against in the game. Sure he still right clicks you for a ton of damage, but hes extremely immobile and has specific times where you can all in him and all he can do is stand still and sperg out (reloading). This is how ALL adcs should be modeled after, IMO.

That's some meaningful and tangible counterplay you can work around, without turning a cannon, wrist crossbow and a sniper into a gattling burst gun.

Actually I'm wrong, they're not nuts. They're perfectly fine. I just checked on the PBE vs live, with the build I normally go it's like 10 extra AD to his passive and about 50 extra damage on his Q. The buff to his W honestly feels like it should have came on release. Just hoping he doesn't get too many buffs to the point where Riot puts him in the gutter. As for landing his W off ult, I don't think this will be possible, and even if it was, usually you'd use your W before ulting to stop them from moving for your team to catch up, then ult them. I can't see the point of using W after you've used everything else because by that point they should be dead. This may just be a PBE bug but his auto attacks feel faster despite having the same attack speed as before(or maybe I'm just not ever used to getting level 18 on Jhin), but I'm almost certain there's a bug rn on PBE that's making lethal tempo actually increase his attack speed for like a second. If you time it right you can get 2 auto attacks right after the other and it feels so amazing. Of course this doesn't happen all the time, but it happens enough from my experience in practice tool.

Now that is a bunch of unnessecery changes. If riot got rid of crit and actually nerfed ADCs that are free wins like Tristana,varus jhin would come out as one of the strongest ADCs without needing any buffs. This buff will end up making him op once the other ADCs or crit items get reworked.

The W root changes are honestly not that over the top. It always made sense that you could root after landing grenade bounces and for the sake of being conservative they didn't let him do it. If he gets too strong reverting the AD ratio changes is still an option, but the root changes are going to make him feel/play a lot better.

Also he has a 46.82% win rate and does not have >50% win rate for any phase of the game (reaching a max of 47.55 in the pre-25 minute window).  I'd say he does need buffs (or at least his competition needs nerfs).
